00026 /*
00027  * lustre/target/tgt_main.c
00028  *
00029  * Lustre Unified Target main initialization code
00030  *
00031  * Author: Mikhail Pershin <mike.pershin@intel.com>
00032  */
00033 
00034 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_CLASS
00035 
00036 #include <obd.h>
00037 #include "tgt_internal.h"
00038 #include "../ptlrpc/ptlrpc_internal.h"
00039 
00040 static spinlock_t uncommitted_slc_locks_guard;
00041 static struct list_head uncommitted_slc_locks;
00042 
00043 /*
00044  * Save cross-MDT lock in uncommitted_slc_locks.
00045  *
00046  * Lock R/W count is not saved, but released in unlock (not canceled remotely),
00047  * instead only a refcount is taken, so that the remote MDT where the object
00048  * resides can detect conflict with this lock there.
00049  *
00050  * \param lock cross-MDT lock to save
00051  * \param transno when the transaction with this transno is committed, this lock
00052  *                can be canceled.
00053  */
00054 void tgt_save_slc_lock(struct ldlm_lock *lock, __u64 transno)
00055 {
00056         spin_lock(&uncommitted_slc_locks_guard);
00057         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
00058         if (ldlm_is_cbpending(lock)) {
00059                 /* if it was canceld by server, don't save, because remote MDT
00060                  * will do Sync-on-Cancel. */
00061                 LDLM_LOCK_PUT(lock);
00062         } else {
00063                 lock->l_transno = transno;
00064                 /* if this lock is in the list already, there are two operations
00065                  * both use this lock, and save it after use, so for the second
00066                  * one, just put the refcount. */
00067                 if (list_empty(&lock->l_slc_link))
00068                         list_add_tail(&lock->l_slc_link,
00069                                       &uncommitted_slc_locks);
00070                 else
00071                         LDLM_LOCK_PUT(lock);
00072         }
00073         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00074         spin_unlock(&uncommitted_slc_locks_guard);
00075 }
00076 EXPORT_SYMBOL(tgt_save_slc_lock);
00077 
00078 /*
00079  * Discard cross-MDT lock from uncommitted_slc_locks.
00080  *
00081  * This is called upon BAST, just remove lock from uncommitted_slc_locks and put
00082  * lock refcount. The BAST will cancel this lock.
00083  *
00084  * \param lock cross-MDT lock to discard
00085  */
00086 void tgt_discard_slc_lock(struct ldlm_lock *lock)
00087 {
00088         spin_lock(&uncommitted_slc_locks_guard);
00089         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
00090         /* may race with tgt_cancel_slc_locks() */
00091         if (lock->l_transno != 0) {
00092                 LASSERT(!list_empty(&lock->l_slc_link));
00093                 LASSERT(ldlm_is_cbpending(lock));
00094                 list_del_init(&lock->l_slc_link);
00095                 lock->l_transno = 0;
00096                 LDLM_LOCK_PUT(lock);
00097         }
00098         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00099         spin_unlock(&uncommitted_slc_locks_guard);
00100 }
00101 EXPORT_SYMBOL(tgt_discard_slc_lock);
00102 
00103 /*
00104  * Cancel cross-MDT locks upon transaction commit.
00105  *
00106  * Remove cross-MDT locks from uncommitted_slc_locks, cancel them and put lock
00107  * refcount.
00108  *
00109  * \param transno transaction with this number was committed.
00110  */
00111 void tgt_cancel_slc_locks(__u64 transno)
00112 {
00113         struct ldlm_lock *lock, *next;
00114         LIST_HEAD(list);
00115         struct lustre_handle lockh;
00116 
00117         spin_lock(&uncommitted_slc_locks_guard);
00118         list_for_each_entry_safe(lock, next, &uncommitted_slc_locks,
00119                                  l_slc_link) {
00120                 lock_res_and_lock(lock);
00121                 LASSERT(lock->l_transno != 0);
00122                 if (lock->l_transno > transno) {
00123                         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00124                         continue;
00125                 }
00126                 /* ouch, another operation is using it after it's saved */
00127                 if (lock->l_readers != 0 || lock->l_writers != 0) {
00128                         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00129                         continue;
00130                 }
00131                 /* set CBPENDING so that this lock won't be used again */
00132                 ldlm_set_cbpending(lock);
00133                 lock->l_transno = 0;
00134                 list_move(&lock->l_slc_link, &list);
00135                 unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00136         }
00137         spin_unlock(&uncommitted_slc_locks_guard);
00138 
00139         list_for_each_entry_safe(lock, next, &list, l_slc_link) {
00140                 list_del_init(&lock->l_slc_link);
00141                 ldlm_lock2handle(lock, &lockh);
00142                 ldlm_cli_cancel(&lockh, LCF_ASYNC);
00143                 LDLM_LOCK_PUT(lock);
00144         }
00145 }
00146 
00147 int tgt_init(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_target *lut,
00148              struct obd_device *obd, struct dt_device *dt,
00149              struct tgt_opc_slice *slice, int request_fail_id,
00150              int reply_fail_id)
00151 {
00152         struct dt_object_format  dof;
00153         struct lu_attr           attr;
00154         struct lu_fid            fid;
00155         struct dt_object        *o;
00156         int                      rc = 0;
00157 
00158         ENTRY;
00159 
00160         LASSERT(lut);
00161         LASSERT(obd);
00162         lut->lut_obd = obd;
00163         lut->lut_bottom = dt;
00164         lut->lut_last_rcvd = NULL;
00165         lut->lut_client_bitmap = NULL;
00166         atomic_set(&lut->lut_num_clients, 0);
00167         atomic_set(&lut->lut_client_generation, 0);
00168         lut->lut_reply_data = NULL;
00169         lut->lut_reply_bitmap = NULL;
00170         obd->u.obt.obt_lut = lut;
00171         obd->u.obt.obt_magic = OBT_MAGIC;
00172 
00173         /* set request handler slice and parameters */
00174         lut->lut_slice = slice;
00175         lut->lut_reply_fail_id = reply_fail_id;
00176         lut->lut_request_fail_id = request_fail_id;
00177 
00178         /* sptlrcp variables init */
00179         rwlock_init(&lut->lut_sptlrpc_lock);
00180         sptlrpc_rule_set_init(&lut->lut_sptlrpc_rset);
00181 
00182         spin_lock_init(&lut->lut_flags_lock);
00183         lut->lut_sync_lock_cancel = NEVER_SYNC_ON_CANCEL;
00184 
00185         /* last_rcvd initialization is needed by replayable targets only */
00186         if (!obd->obd_replayable)
00187                 RETURN(0);
00188 
00189         spin_lock_init(&lut->lut_translock);
00190         spin_lock_init(&lut->lut_client_bitmap_lock);
00191 
00192         OBD_ALLOC(lut->lut_client_bitmap, LR_MAX_CLIENTS >> 3);
00193         if (lut->lut_client_bitmap == NULL)
00194                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00195 
00196         memset(&attr, 0, sizeof(attr));
00197         attr.la_valid = LA_MODE;
00198         attr.la_mode = S_IFREG | S_IRUGO | S_IWUSR;
00199         dof.dof_type = dt_mode_to_dft(S_IFREG);
00200 
00201         lu_local_obj_fid(&fid, LAST_RECV_OID);
00202 
00203         o = dt_find_or_create(env, lut->lut_bottom, &fid, &dof, &attr);
00204         if (IS_ERR(o)) {
00205                 rc = PTR_ERR(o);
00206                 CERROR("%s: cannot open LAST_RCVD: rc = %d\n", tgt_name(lut),
00207                        rc);
00208                 GOTO(out_put, rc);
00209         }
00210 
00211         lut->lut_last_rcvd = o;
00212         rc = tgt_server_data_init(env, lut);
00213         if (rc < 0)
00214                 GOTO(out_put, rc);
00215 
00216         /* prepare transactions callbacks */
00217         lut->lut_txn_cb.dtc_txn_start = tgt_txn_start_cb;
00218         lut->lut_txn_cb.dtc_txn_stop = tgt_txn_stop_cb;
00219         lut->lut_txn_cb.dtc_txn_commit = NULL;
00220         lut->lut_txn_cb.dtc_cookie = lut;
00221         lut->lut_txn_cb.dtc_tag = LCT_DT_THREAD | LCT_MD_THREAD;
00222         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&lut->lut_txn_cb.dtc_linkage);
00223 
00224         dt_txn_callback_add(lut->lut_bottom, &lut->lut_txn_cb);
00225         lut->lut_bottom->dd_lu_dev.ld_site->ls_tgt = lut;
00226 
00227         /* reply_data is supported by MDT targets only for now */
00228         if (strncmp(obd->obd_type->typ_name, LUSTRE_MDT_NAME, 3) != 0)
00229                 RETURN(0);
00230 
00231         OBD_ALLOC(lut->lut_reply_bitmap,
00232                   LUT_REPLY_SLOTS_MAX_CHUNKS * sizeof(unsigned long *));
00233         if (lut->lut_reply_bitmap == NULL)
00234                 GOTO(out, rc);
00235 
00236         memset(&attr, 0, sizeof(attr));
00237         attr.la_valid = LA_MODE;
00238         attr.la_mode = S_IFREG | S_IRUGO | S_IWUSR;
00239         dof.dof_type = dt_mode_to_dft(S_IFREG);
00240 
00241         lu_local_obj_fid(&fid, REPLY_DATA_OID);
00242 
00243         o = dt_find_or_create(env, lut->lut_bottom, &fid, &dof, &attr);
00244         if (IS_ERR(o)) {
00245                 rc = PTR_ERR(o);
00246                 CERROR("%s: cannot open REPLY_DATA: rc = %d\n", tgt_name(lut),
00247                        rc);
00248                 GOTO(out, rc);
00249         }
00250         lut->lut_reply_data = o;
00251 
00252         rc = tgt_reply_data_init(env, lut);
00253         if (rc < 0)
00254                 GOTO(out, rc);
00255 
00256         atomic_set(&lut->lut_sync_count, 0);
00257 
00258         RETURN(0);
00259 
00260 out:
00261         dt_txn_callback_del(lut->lut_bottom, &lut->lut_txn_cb);
00262 out_put:
00263         obd->u.obt.obt_magic = 0;
00264         obd->u.obt.obt_lut = NULL;
00265         if (lut->lut_last_rcvd != NULL) {
00266                 lu_object_put(env, &lut->lut_last_rcvd->do_lu);
00267                 lut->lut_last_rcvd = NULL;
00268         }
00269         if (lut->lut_client_bitmap != NULL)
00270                 OBD_FREE(lut->lut_client_bitmap, LR_MAX_CLIENTS >> 3);
00271         lut->lut_client_bitmap = NULL;
00272         if (lut->lut_reply_data != NULL)
00273                 lu_object_put(env, &lut->lut_reply_data->do_lu);
00274         lut->lut_reply_data = NULL;
00275         if (lut->lut_reply_bitmap != NULL)
00276                 OBD_FREE(lut->lut_reply_bitmap,
00277                          LUT_REPLY_SLOTS_MAX_CHUNKS * sizeof(unsigned long *));
00278         lut->lut_reply_bitmap = NULL;
00279         return rc;
00280 }
00281 EXPORT_SYMBOL(tgt_init);
00282 
00283 void tgt_fini(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_target *lut)
00284 {
00285         int i;
00286         int rc;
00287         ENTRY;
00288 
00289         if (lut->lut_lsd.lsd_feature_incompat & OBD_INCOMPAT_MULTI_RPCS &&
00290             atomic_read(&lut->lut_num_clients) == 0) {
00291                 /* Clear MULTI RPCS incompatibility flag that prevents previous
00292                  * Lustre versions to mount a target with reply_data file */
00293                 lut->lut_lsd.lsd_feature_incompat &= ~OBD_INCOMPAT_MULTI_RPCS;
00294                 rc = tgt_server_data_update(env, lut, 1);
00295                 if (rc < 0)
00296                         CERROR("%s: unable to clear MULTI RPCS "
00297                                "incompatibility flag\n",
00298                                lut->lut_obd->obd_name);
00299         }
00300 
00301         sptlrpc_rule_set_free(&lut->lut_sptlrpc_rset);
00302 
00303         if (lut->lut_reply_data != NULL)
00304                 lu_object_put(env, &lut->lut_reply_data->do_lu);
00305         lut->lut_reply_data = NULL;
00306         if (lut->lut_reply_bitmap != NULL) {
00307                 for (i = 0; i < LUT_REPLY_SLOTS_MAX_CHUNKS; i++) {
00308                         if (lut->lut_reply_bitmap[i] != NULL)
00309                                 OBD_FREE(lut->lut_reply_bitmap[i],
00310                                     BITS_TO_LONGS(LUT_REPLY_SLOTS_PER_CHUNK) *
00311                                     sizeof(long));
00312                         lut->lut_reply_bitmap[i] = NULL;
00313                 }
00314                 OBD_FREE(lut->lut_reply_bitmap,
00315                          LUT_REPLY_SLOTS_MAX_CHUNKS * sizeof(unsigned long *));
00316         }
00317         lut->lut_reply_bitmap = NULL;
00318         if (lut->lut_client_bitmap) {
00319                 OBD_FREE(lut->lut_client_bitmap, LR_MAX_CLIENTS >> 3);
00320                 lut->lut_client_bitmap = NULL;
00321         }
00322         if (lut->lut_last_rcvd) {
00323                 dt_txn_callback_del(lut->lut_bottom, &lut->lut_txn_cb);
00324                 lu_object_put(env, &lut->lut_last_rcvd->do_lu);
00325                 lut->lut_last_rcvd = NULL;
00326         }
00327         EXIT;
00328 }
00329 EXPORT_SYMBOL(tgt_fini);
00330 
00331 /* context key constructor/destructor: tg_key_init, tg_key_fini */
00332 LU_KEY_INIT(tgt, struct tgt_thread_info);
00333 
00334 static void tgt_key_fini(const struct lu_context *ctx,
00335                          struct lu_context_key *key, void *data)
00336 {
00337         struct tgt_thread_info          *info = data;
00338         struct thandle_exec_args        *args = &info->tti_tea;
00339         int                             i;
00340 
00341         for (i = 0; i < args->ta_alloc_args; i++) {
00342                 if (args->ta_args[i] != NULL)
00343                         OBD_FREE_PTR(args->ta_args[i]);
00344         }
00345 
00346         if (args->ta_args != NULL)
00347                 OBD_FREE(args->ta_args, sizeof(args->ta_args[0]) *
00348                                         args->ta_alloc_args);
00349         OBD_FREE_PTR(info);
00350 }
00351 
00352 static void tgt_key_exit(const struct lu_context *ctx,
00353                          struct lu_context_key *key, void *data)
00354 {
00355         struct tgt_thread_info *tti = data;
00356 
00357         tti->tti_has_trans = 0;
00358         tti->tti_mult_trans = 0;
00359 }
00360 
00361 /* context key: tg_thread_key */
00362 struct lu_context_key tgt_thread_key = {
00363         .lct_tags = LCT_MD_THREAD | LCT_DT_THREAD,
00364         .lct_init = tgt_key_init,
00365         .lct_fini = tgt_key_fini,
00366         .lct_exit = tgt_key_exit,
00367 };
00368 
00369 LU_KEY_INIT_GENERIC(tgt);
00370 
00371 /* context key constructor/destructor: tgt_ses_key_init, tgt_ses_key_fini */
00372 LU_KEY_INIT_FINI(tgt_ses, struct tgt_session_info);
00373 
00374 /* context key: tgt_session_key */
00375 struct lu_context_key tgt_session_key = {
00376         .lct_tags = LCT_SERVER_SESSION,
00377         .lct_init = tgt_ses_key_init,
00378         .lct_fini = tgt_ses_key_fini,
00379 };
00380 EXPORT_SYMBOL(tgt_session_key);
00381 
00382 LU_KEY_INIT_GENERIC(tgt_ses);
00383 
00384 /*
00385  * this page is allocated statically when module is initializing
00386  * it is used to simulate data corruptions, see ost_checksum_bulk()
00387  * for details. as the original pages provided by the layers below
00388  * can be remain in the internal cache, we do not want to modify
00389  * them.
00390  */
00391 struct page *tgt_page_to_corrupt;
00392 
00393 int tgt_mod_init(void)
00394 {
00395         ENTRY;
00396 
00397         tgt_page_to_corrupt = alloc_page(GFP_KERNEL);
00398 
00399         tgt_key_init_generic(&tgt_thread_key, NULL);
00400         lu_context_key_register_many(&tgt_thread_key, NULL);
00401 
00402         tgt_ses_key_init_generic(&tgt_session_key, NULL);
00403         lu_context_key_register_many(&tgt_session_key, NULL);
00404 
00405         update_info_init();
00406 
00407         spin_lock_init(&uncommitted_slc_locks_guard);
00408         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&uncommitted_slc_locks);
00409 
00410         RETURN(0);
00411 }
00412 
00413 void tgt_mod_exit(void)
00414 {
00415         if (tgt_page_to_corrupt != NULL)
00416                 page_cache_release(tgt_page_to_corrupt);
00417 
00418         lu_context_key_degister(&tgt_thread_key);
00419         lu_context_key_degister(&tgt_session_key);
00420         update_info_fini();
00421 }
